captions.text: If I run I can drift it a little bit get it out. One hand.
That was for the camera.
Woo hoo!
This is the manliest thing I've ever done in my life.
If you were to turn the clock back one generation

and do a Head to Head about small, sporty
German cars

you most likely wind up with the BMW E30
M3
verses the Mercedes-Benz 190 2.3.

But then things got crazy the horsepower
wars got underway

to put the cars on growth hormones and
you wind up with stuff

like the C 63 AMG Black Series and the
upcoming
m4. They're cool cars but they're almost too much they're
track cars for the street instead of streetcars that you might once
in awhile take to the track.

But of course the more things change the
more they change right back which is why

I'm standing in front of the
Mercedes-Benz CLA 45 AMG
and the all-new BMW M235i.

But which one is the better car which
is more fun to drive?
That what we're gonna find out.

Whipping around here in the M235i
and let's start off with the look
because
unlike the 1-Series I like this car.

I think it's one of the best BMW front ends
in a very long time.

I love the character line that runs all
the way around the upper part of the car

the rear end of the car is good the tail lights
are good I love the hard side.
That said I love how this thing drives
that is such a fun car.
The new German buzzword is Kinematics because dynamism is
so 2013. Anyways Kinematics
which means stuff like bushings and
anti roll bars the actual dampers themselves and spring breaks are
all new obviously tons of engine 3-liter
goes like hell great throttle response especially when you're in Sport Plus
I've got the 8 speed transmission. I'd be

very curious to see how this car behaves
with a manual.
The HVZF is quite good and I like it better than the dual clutch in the AMG.
As far as automatics go this is good but
still an automatic that said you can go just
crazy on the back roads in this thing.

I like the steering I understand its not the
greatest BMW's steering feel of all time
but pretty dang good. Loads up really well
unlike the AMG which just unwinds very well.

It does drive exceptionally well you how
small little rear wheel drive cars

they're rare these days and when you can
find one

they're just so much fun. Dives in the
corner wonderful steering.
and if you're listening this far you're thinking 'wow
likes guy likes the BMW'.
And I do but there's not to say there's a lot of drawbacks from this car.
One of which, especially compared to the AMG,
are the brakes. You've got to get way into the pedal to start to get some stopping
power.
And for such a quick, kinda aggressive car that's not good.
And if you're going to slap all the M-badges on the car give me some M-worthy
brakes I know it's not M2 I know it's not really from M-division
but

it needs better breaks. And I should point
out
this car still has a handbrake.
(laugh) That felt great.
In summary the M235i: a

hell of a car. Fun to drive, handles
really well,

gobs of power, could use better brakes but is
it more fun to drive than that AMG?
The Mercedes-Benz CLA 45 AMG
and this is a good car too just instantly going back and forth from
the BMW to this car

a lot I can tell you: I like the brakes
on his car better I like the way this
steering wheel feels as much as I like the BMW the all terra

grips on this are just fantastic this feels like
more engine
and it's probably what I'm feeling
is the all-wheel drive grip allowing me to kind of get on the power earlier in this thing.
Its a pretty special car.
The steering on this, you know, the AMG is gonna

not load up as well as the BMW but it
unwinds

just terrific gets back on center so
well.

I will say this this is an exceptional
car to drive at
8 out of 10 just right up to where your limits and the cars limits are.
One you kind of really get up to the edge t's a little squirrely. The brakes
on the AMG are so
much better than the M235i they bite once you get into the pedal

it just feels strong and solid. In our
testing the BMW actually does stop
quicker

like once or twice, but these are the
brakes you're going to want to have.
These are good brakes.
But there's a lot of things I don't like about the CLA those are

the looks America its your fault this
car is as ugly as it is and here's why
over in Europe Mercedes makes the A45 its
this gorgeous 5-door hatch back wagon thing stunning looking

and from the B-pillar forward this looks the
same

but then you have this kind of truncated
miniature sedan body
just looks terrible of course
the big news is the engine. 355

horsepower out of a 2-liter,
four-cylinder with the turbo

I remember when I was growing up in a
Corvette made 250 horsepower
I mean this is amazing.
Then there's the transmission this is a seven-speed dual-clutch

this transition gives dual clutch a bad name
its

very hesitant to shift especially when
you're at like

4,000 RPM and you're looking at about a
62-50 red line

and you pull a downshift and it won't it just
won't let you down shift when it

does let you shift it is slow in fact so
slow

let me show you the gears up here
1,2,3,4,5,6,7
and you'll pull the paddle and hear it visually switch to the gear you want
and a second after that it shifts gears

its really the worst part of the card it's
so frustrating like
an AMG you're supposed to be best in breed right?
Transmission totally not. So

which do I like better the answers are
not sure.

Uh there's a lot of things about this car I
like more than the BMW
and there's a lot of things I like about the BMW but overall
a little bit more fun to drive but this one sounds a bit better
and I think this grips a little more and has better brakes

I think in this situation then the only
sensible thing to do
is call my friend Randy Pobst have him fly to California

take both these cars to a race track to
settle it.
Streets of Willow
BMW M235i.
(laugh) you went thru that so fast.
Good entry speed. The BMW is that kind of car boy does it put a smile on my face.
Good balance, it's so good
when I get on the power I actually take the heat out.
It's sweet Johnnie. I also like the engine a turbo six.
You'd never know it was a turbo I don't feel lag it's just a linear
power delivery with a broad torque curve.
The steering is quick it feels great.
The tranny's shifting great

I really love it. Kinda makes you
wonder why do you need the expense and
and density of a dual clutch? You bet.
You were telling me something I found very interesting I guess this is the Randy Pobst

understeer or oversteer scale. You said a
balanced car is a zero

that you can go -10 for understeer or +10 for
oversteer.
What's ideal? Well I think ideal is about 100 here.
Oh really? Yeah because it's more stable

but about 1 oversteer is more fun this
car

is a little bit on the oversteer side
just a little like a 1/2 or a 1
oversteer. See how I take wheel out?
And it's kind of beautifully balanced.
There's a fun factor to this that to me is just

absent from the AMG. I agree and that's
because of the balance

the fact that the horsepower actually
reduces understeer
whereas in a Mercedes the horsepower increases understeer

and that just feels like it's a cross
purpose for what you're really trying to
accomplish. This is my favorite BMW
in the last 10 years. That's an amazing statement so well balanced. Think about
all the BMWs Iv'e seen in the last 10 years. Just dozens and dozens

this is the one the M235i which you
think is the best driving one.
Yep because that balance it's a dance partner I could

put it right where I wanted its really
rewarding.
Wow the engine's great.
But the understeer's not so great. Yeah but what an engine let's

stop for a second I mean 2-liters 355
horsepower

330 pound-feet of torque you know what I
means it's incredible!
It is and it gets more powerful as it revs.
Really a satisfying, sporty feeling.
Feel the power build down these short straight aways. I also noticed just twice in a
row now that the brakes
seem to be more immediate than the BMWs.
Yes there's still some travel but the pedal feels a lot better to me
than the BMW.
(laugh) Yeah we're on you were thinking I wasn't actually going to make it.

Honestly this through the kink there
this is not nearly as spooky
as what it felt like in the M235i and I think it's because
suspension isn't bouncing around as much I think this is damn better
it's a stiffer flip to your ride. Yes it is. See this understeer I get here?
Makes me worry about going off the road with a bunch of wheel in it.
Power understeer. That

I find unsatisfying. The shift does not
happen
fast enough than the CLA I have to
almost shift at 5800
to make sure I don't hit the rev limiter at 6250. In the Mercedes
you're in a narrower range of performance

in terms of understeer or oversteer. It's
more stable

and that's actually really good for a
lot of drivers.
But the BMW gives a satisfying feel of balance

of dancing the car of choosing between
understeer and oversteer
and that makes it a better driver's car
and the car that I like better.

And now here's a side by side look at
Randy's hot laps.

Very close race but the more muscular
motor in the AMG
is gonna win it just by a hair.

You've made it to the end of the video
and at this point you probably want a
winner.
And so do I. Here's my dilemma the CLA
is faster in a straight line is faster in our figure 8

as Randy showed us it is faster around a
racetrack but
the BMW costs less and it's more fun to drive

how do you choose? I guess if you held
me face to the fire

I'd go with the BMW but it just doesn't
feel right

if only there was some car that was
faster than the AMG on a racetrack

and was as much fun to drive as the BMW.
But cost less than both of them.
See you next time.
Down boy sit, down boy!
Good entry speed. That was a lot of entry speed.
I know a shortcut I think I shut my eyes (laugh).

comments.author: hamronD73

comments.text:
Jonny really doesn't want to give it up much for the M235i, which is 
walking away with most comparisons. Notice how Randy starts talking about 
his  disappointment with the AMG understeer and Jonny quickly interupts 
with, "But let's talk about the fantastic engine."

After 15 minutes of exhaustive video comparisons, he still doesn't want to 
give the BMW its props, as he says:
"I GUESS I'd pick the BMW, but it just doesn't feel right." before he 
quickly pivots to the Subaru...an entirely different class of vehicle, with 
nothing premium about it.
Note that Randy clearly says it's the better driver's car and his favorite 
BMW in 10 years. BOOM!

-For all those talking about snow and AWD?  It's available in the BMW now.
-Looks. Virtually every comparison agrees the BMW looks better.
-Transmissions? The BMW is a much better A/T than the DCT in the MB, which 
has molasses-slow shifts
-Motor, brakes, handling?  Grab some of the $14k you'll save on the BMW in 
this comparison, and drop in the BMW M Performance Brakes, suspension and a 
minor tune and this will clearly kill the MB on a track.
-Car & Driver 10 best: M235i, CLA nowhere near the list
-Edmunds rates the M235i an "A", the CLA a "B"
-Motor Trend, AutoGuide, Drag Times all give the nod to the M235i
-Consumer Reports rates the M235i the #2 car of 2014, under the Tesla Model 
S. It scores above the Porsche 911 and new Corvette. Highest rated BMW ever 
by them.
-Drive both of these cars around town for 20 minutes and see how many teeth 
you have left after getting out of the MB. Very jarring ride.

I'm not saying the MB sucks or doesn't have some advantages. 4 doors, 
interior bling, etc. I'm just saying that the M235i is the best BMW in 
years and virtually every direct comparison between these 2 cars shows the 
M235i winning.﻿

comments.text:
While I respect your opinion, and you did make some valid points, here's my 
perspective. I've been a lifelong Honda driver, and only recently switched 
to German performance cars. I've ordered an M235i.

I think that people who buy these expensive performance cars (including me 
now) are making a tradeoff - expensive but fun VS economical but boring. I 
know that these 2 cars are WAY MORE FUN to drive than a Honda Accord or 
Toyota Camry. Can we agree on that ?

I personally think that these cars are worth the money (and yes, I agree 
that they are overpriced) simply because they put a smile on your face, and 
for some people, that's what really matters - enjoying the driving 
experience.

We are not all stupid, Sir :)
comments.author: Happy Idiot

comments.text:
The guy with the beard is extremely annoying, to say the least ... totally 
unprofessional. Acts like a 7 year old with a candy bar, and tries his best 
to sound like a know-it-all. As someone interested in the M235i (I bought 
one), I'd be much more likely to listen to and believe someone who's 
professional and makes it clear that what he says about certain things 
(like the looks of the car) are his opinion and doesn't generalize it.

I know that he wants to sound enthusiastic ... I get that, but acting the 
way he does in this video just makes him seem immature and childish. You 
can appear enthusiastic and be professional at the same time.

I'd think that Motor Trend Channel would get more views and likes if they 
started acting more professional in their videos, and not like little kids 
with toys.﻿
